segment.source: Microsoft Edge and Internet Explorer 11 (Microsoft Edge for IT Pros)
segment.target: Microsoft Edge and Internet Explorer 11 (Microsoft Edge for IT Pros)

segment.source: Enterprise guidance for using Microsoft Edge and Internet Explorer 11.
segment.target: Enterprise guidance for using Microsoft Edge and Internet Explorer 11.

segment.source: Browser: Microsoft Edge and Internet Explorer 11
segment.target: Browser: Microsoft Edge and Internet Explorer 11

segment.source: Microsoft Edge content applies to:
segment.target: Microsoft Edge content applies to:

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows 10 Mobile
segment.target: Windows 10 Mobile

segment.source: Internet Explorer 11 content applies to:
segment.target: Internet Explorer 11 content applies to:

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Enterprise guidance
segment.target: Enterprise guidance

segment.source: Microsoft Edge is the default browser experience for Windows 10 and Windows 10 Mobile.
segment.target: Microsoft Edge is the default browser experience for Windows 10 and Windows 10 Mobile.

segment.source: However, if you're running web apps that need ActiveX controls, we recommend that you continue to use Internet Explorer 11 for them.
segment.target: However, if you're running web apps that need ActiveX controls, we recommend that you continue to use Internet Explorer 11 for them.

segment.source: If you don't have IE11 installed anymore, you can download it from the Windows Store or from the Internet Explorer 11 download page.
segment.target: If you don't have IE11 installed anymore, you can download it from the Windows Store or from the Internet Explorer 11 download page.

segment.source: We also recommend that you upgrade to IE11 if you're running any earlier versions of Internet Explorer.
segment.target: We also recommend that you upgrade to IE11 if you're running any earlier versions of Internet Explorer.

segment.source: IE11 is supported on Windows 7, Windows 8.1, and Windows 10.
segment.target: IE11 is supported on Windows 7, Windows 8.1, and Windows 10.

segment.source: So any legacy apps that work with IE11 will continue to work even as you migrate to Windows 10.
segment.target: So any legacy apps that work with IE11 will continue to work even as you migrate to Windows 10.

segment.source: Microsoft Edge
segment.target: Microsoft Edge

segment.source: Microsoft Edge takes you beyond just browsing to actively engaging with the web through features like Web Note, Reading View, and Cortana.
segment.target: Microsoft Edge takes you beyond just browsing to actively engaging with the web through features like Web Note, Reading View, and Cortana.

segment.source: Web Note.
segment.target: Web Note.

segment.source: Microsoft Edge lets you annotate, highlight, and call things out directly on webpages.
segment.target: Microsoft Edge lets you annotate, highlight, and call things out directly on webpages.

segment.source: Reading view.
segment.target: Reading view.

segment.source: Microsoft Edge lets you enjoy and print online articles in a distraction-free layout that's optimized for your screen size.
segment.target: Microsoft Edge lets you enjoy and print online articles in a distraction-free layout that's optimized for your screen size.

segment.source: While in reading view, you can also save webpages or PDF files to your reading list, for later viewing.
segment.target: While in reading view, you can also save webpages or PDF files to your reading list, for later viewing.

segment.source: Cortana.
segment.target: Cortana.

segment.source: Cortana is automatically enabled on Microsoft Edge.
segment.target: Cortana is automatically enabled on Microsoft Edge.

segment.source: Microsoft Edge lets you highlight words for more info and gives you one-click access to things like restaurant reservations and reviews, without leaving the webpage.
segment.target: Microsoft Edge lets you highlight words for more info and gives you one-click access to things like restaurant reservations and reviews, without leaving the webpage.

segment.source: Compatibility and security.
segment.target: Compatibility and security.

segment.source: Microsoft Edge lets you continue to use IE11 for sites that are on your corporate intranet or that are included on your Enterprise Mode Site List.
segment.target: Microsoft Edge lets you continue to use IE11 for sites that are on your corporate intranet or that are included on your Enterprise Mode Site List.

segment.source: You must use IE11 to run older, less secure technology, such as ActiveX controls.
segment.target: You must use IE11 to run older, less secure technology, such as ActiveX controls.

segment.source: IE11
segment.target: IE11

segment.source: IE11 offers enterprises additional security, manageability, performance, backward compatibility, and modern standards support.
segment.target: IE11 offers enterprises additional security, manageability, performance, backward compatibility, and modern standards support.

segment.source: Backward compatibility.
segment.target: Backward compatibility.

segment.source: IE11 supports 9 document modes that include high-fidelity emulations for older versions of IE.
segment.target: IE11 supports 9 document modes that include high-fidelity emulations for older versions of IE.

segment.source: Modern web standards.
segment.target: Modern web standards.

segment.source: IE11 supports modern web technologies like HTML5, CSS3, and WebGL, which help to ensure today's modern websites and apps work just as well as your old, legacy websites and apps.
segment.target: IE11 supports modern web technologies like HTML5, CSS3, and WebGL, which help to ensure today's modern websites and apps work just as well as your old, legacy websites and apps.

segment.source: More secure.
segment.target: More secure.

segment.source: IE11 was designed with security in mind and is more secure than older versions.
segment.target: IE11 was designed with security in mind and is more secure than older versions.

segment.source: Using security features like SmartScreen and Enhanced Protected Mode can help IE11 reduce your risk.
segment.target: Using security features like SmartScreen and Enhanced Protected Mode can help IE11 reduce your risk.

segment.source: Faster.
segment.target: Faster.

segment.source: IE11 is significantly faster than previous versions of Internet Explorer, taking advantage of network optimization and hardware-accelerated text, graphics, and JavaScript rendering.
segment.target: IE11 is significantly faster than previous versions of Internet Explorer, taking advantage of network optimization and hardware-accelerated text, graphics, and JavaScript rendering.

segment.source: Easier migration to Windows 10.
segment.target: Easier migration to Windows 10.

segment.source: IE11 is the only version of IE that runs on Windows 7, Windows 8.1, and Windows 10.
segment.target: IE11 is the only version of IE that runs on Windows 7, Windows 8.1, and Windows 10.

segment.source: Upgrading to IE11 on Windows 7 can also help your organization support the next generation of software, services, and devices.
segment.target: Upgrading to IE11 on Windows 7 can also help your organization support the next generation of software, services, and devices.

segment.source: Administration.
segment.target: Administration.

segment.source: IE11 can use the Internet Explorer Administration Kit (IEAK) 11 or MSIs for deployment, and includes more than 1,600 Group Policies and preferences for granular control.
segment.target: IE11 can use the Internet Explorer Administration Kit (IEAK) 11 or MSIs for deployment, and includes more than 1,600 Group Policies and preferences for granular control.

segment.target: Related topics
